race.name: Cedar Blitz
race.tagline: West Michigan gravel in Cedar Springs near Grand Rapids.

climate.description: Summer conditions with potential for heat.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through west Michigan. Rolling terrain with moderate elevation.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Small grassroots west Michigan event. Affordable and near Grand Rapids but limited infrastructure.

biased_opinion.summary: Cedar Blitz is a small grassroots gravel race in west Michigan near Grand Rapids. The proximity to Grand Rapids gives it better access than some rural events, but it's still a small regional race with basic organization and limited field depth. It's an honest local event with rolling terrain and affordable pricing for Michigan cyclists.
weaknesses: Small field with no competitive depth
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A small local gravel race in west Michigan. Perfect for locals or Grand Rapids area cyclists who want an affordable summer ride. Not worth traveling far for.

final_verdict.one_liner: Small grassroots west Michigan ride near Grand Rapids.
final_verdict.should_you_race: Only if you're in west Michigan or the Grand Rapids area and want an affordable gravel ride. Not worth traveling for.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Michigan events: Barry-Roubaix, Lumberjack 100. For similar grassroots vibes: other regional Midwest events.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Cedar Springs has basic lodging. Grand Rapids (30 min) has more options.
logistics.food: Small city with dining options. Stock race nutrition beforehand.

history.origin_story: Grassroots gravel event in west Michigan.

course_description.character: Rolling west Michigan gravel through rural areas.
course_description.signature_challenge: Rolling west Michigan terrain and summer heat.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: 62 miles of west Michigan gravel near Grand Rapids.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Small grassroots event in Cedar Springs.

logistics.explanation: Downtown Cedar Springs start/finish at the brewery creates centralized logistics with post-race festival atmosphere. Tracy Gravlin confirms the payoff: "The tasty Cedar Springs Ale was our reward! We both are going home with a growler." Holiday Inn lodging keeps accommodations simple.

length.explanation: Four distance options from 18-mile beginner to 130-mile ultra hit the right spread. Tracy Gravlin's 50-mile experience shows proper mid-race challenge: "The start was fast and felt great. About 26 miles in, the head winds seemed to be everywhere you turned." Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Beth Huffaker describes the course as "fast, no chunky gravel and no giant hills" - flowing rather than punishing through Michigan farmland. The terrain favors speed over technical bike handling through "beautiful farm country" without sustained climbing challenges. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: Rider reports confirm "no giant hills" through the 3000 feet of elevation over 62 miles. Michigan's glacial terrain delivers rolling farmland without sustained climbs - punchy but manageable, creating fatigue through repetition rather than epic ascents. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 82Â°F and lows of 63Â°F, with a 49% chance of rain on any given day. Wind becomes the primary weather challenge rather than temperature extremes. Tracy Gravlin experienced significant "head winds everywhere you turned" starting around mile 26, making solo riding particularly difficult through the exposed farm country sections. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Cedar Springs sits at standard Midwest elevation well under 1000 feet. No altitude effects or thin air challenges - just Great Lakes region farmland where humidity creates more breathing difficulty than oxygen deprivation. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds â€” no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The 130-mile ultra offers true adventure with GPS navigation, mandatory lights, and complete self-support through unmarked terrain. Shorter distances stick to well-marked routes with full support - safe but predictable through rural Michigan forests.

prestige.explanation: Growing regional reputation as "one of the fastest growing gravel races in the region" but limited national draw. Field depth remains thin - Tracy Gravlin notes "Beth and I were the only women in the 60+" category, highlighting minimal competitive depth.

race_quality.explanation: Dragon Adventures Base Camp describes it as a "well-organized, high-energy gravel race" with proper timing and aid stations. The race proceeds in most weather conditions with director discretion for severe storms, maintaining consistent execution.

experience.explanation: Post-race atmosphere delivers festival vibes downtown. Dragon Adventures Base Camp captured it perfectly: "The post-race hangout, and great local food made the finish line feel like a festival" with craft beer and community celebration at Cedar Springs Brewery.

community.explanation: Strong community building draws riders nationally â€” "The BaseCamp community has given me so many cycling friends from across the country. Beth came up from Kansas!" Downtown brewery finish creates town square atmosphere with 500+ riders in 2024, making it "one of the fastest growing gravel races in the region."

field_depth.explanation: Participatory rather than competitive depth. Tracy Gravlin's observation that "we came in ahead of the 50-59 and one of the 40-49" from the thin 60+ field shows limited age group participation across categories. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Four distance options with full support, timing, medical coverage, and downtown festival atmosphere deliver strong value. The complete package covers "beginner-friendly routes to leg-burning challenges" with post-race craft beer celebration included.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $60-90. Cedar Springs location keeps costs reasonable with Holiday Inn standard pricing and downtown brewery logistics avoiding expensive shuttles. Rural Michigan setting maintains accessibility for regional travel without big-city event pricing inflation. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: Cedar Blitz gravel race Cedar Springs

videos.title: Cedar Blitz Gravel Race 2024 - 36 Mile (4k)
videos.description:
This is my view of the 2024 Cedar Blitz Gravel Race, which takes place in Cedar Springs, MI. This race is the 36 mile distance, starting and finishing in front of Cedar Springs Brewing Company on Main St. in Cedar Springs. The race took place on July 13, 2024, with the weather being a toasty 75F, calm, and humid at the starting line.

This course is quite flat, allowing for high speeds and solid drafting tactics. I ended up in a great group a couple miles into the gravel, and we worked together for most of the race. With a few miles left, five of us decided to crank up the pace a little and broke off the front. I ended up hitting a wall after a few turns on the front but then did my best to beat that pack I had ridden with to the finish line.

This was an awesome event, so kudos to Rogue Racing Promotions for their efforts in putting this together and running a top-notch event!

Cameras: GoPro Hero 11 (front), GoPro Hero 9 (back)
Bike: 2024 Intense 951 Gravel

0:00 - Neutral Roll Out
7:45 - Start of the Gravel
11:40 - Early Groups
16:00 - Myers Lake
19:35 - Back to Gravel
21:40 - Riding the Mid-pack Train
1:22:00 - Getting Organized on the Front
1:24:45 - Breaking Away From the Group
1:30:50 - Unable to Keep up the Pace
1:36:30 - Trying to Beat the Group to the Line
videos.curation_reason: High quality 4K first-person race experience with detailed course and weather conditions.

videos.title: Cedar Blitz Gravel Race 2024 34 Mile Lead Group
videos.description: Cedar Spring, MI hosted the 9th stop of the Michigan Gravel Race Series. Fast gravel, sunny skies and a downtown start/finish all pointed to a great race!
videos.curation_reason: Lead group perspective showing race tactics and competitive dynamics on the course.

videos.title: Cedar Blitz - 50mi (Gravel Race) 2024
videos.description:
ðŸ‘‰ Hey! SUBSCRIBE for free WATTS ðŸ‘‰ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsr-SU_SAqjrzmu4kXIRfUQ?sub_confirmation=1

The Cedar Blitz gravel race took place on July 13th, 2024 in Cedar Springs, MI. As part of the Michigan Gravel Race Series (MGRS) the "Long" course was the 50 mile version.  

The race started with a 2 mile neutral roll out until we hit the gravel.  Legs felt good and I was able to stay with the lead group. However, this group was quite big with 33 riders making it to the finish line. This was despite numerous attempts at breakaways throughout the race. The last mile into the finish line was pretty sketchy. I tried to make myself towards the front in the final couple miles knowing that there was a high speed chicane with some loose corners. I thought I was about top 10-15 wheels, but I was actually closer to 25th. So I was out of position and to make mattes worse we were passing riders from shorter race course distances. I had to do several mini sprints to make up spots and had nothing left for my actual sprint at the finish line.  I clawed back a few places and ended up 18th overall, just 6 seconds behind first.

Happy with the results but I actually got all time 3rd on the Strava segment "Cedar Blitz Final Sprint". Which means I had the power, I just messed up the lead in to the finish.

videos.curation_reason: Highest view count first-person race recap of the longest distance with detailed race dynamics.

videos.title: Cedar Blitz 36 mile Gravel Race - (short vid)
videos.description:
The Cedar Blitz 36 Mile Gravel race in Cedar Springs, MI, on 13 July 2024. It was a fun little course with some nice fast roads, mild elevation changes, and a decent gravel/paved mix. Makes for a fast race.
I overheated, and both legs cramped up completely by the end of the race, but I finished. 
thus was my first time here. I'll definitely be back next year.

videos.title: Cedar Blitz 2025 Trailer
videos.description:
July 12, 2025 - Get ready to be a part of our legacy at The Cedar Blitz. 
.
It's time to take your shot at the podium, in one of the fastest growing Gravel races in the Michigan Gravel Series! Register now at www.cedarblitz.com.
.
Are you an expert cyclist or a casual cyclist?
Here at the Cedar Blitz, we encourage any and every skill level to compete and be a part of our event! Secure your slot for a chance to win cash prizes, medals, and more!
.
.
We have proudly organized this event for 5 years now! We would like to extend our appreciation and thanks from the Cedar Blitz Team, to all of our sponsors, racers, volunteers, and our crew members for making this such a meaningful and special event to the biking community.
.
.
All video, audio, and graphic production elements displayed were performed in-house by our production team here at the Cedar Blitz.
